issue.title: Add option to visualize <link> reference frame axis.  visualize <collision> and <visual> frame axis.

content.raw:
I'm also working on some frame visualization for the Apply Force GUI, and it is needed on the Model Editor as well.

1. I think we should decide on a standard way of representing frames across all tools.

1. This will be probably tricky, but it would be great to visually tell if it's a model frame, or a link frame, collision, visual...

1. This is the current state of the Force GUI, the thin lines represent the link frame. 

    * Pros: It stretches outside of the link, no need to view transparent. 

    * Cons: Might become too cluttered; No direction.

![force.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3831744543-force.png)

1. I have an old implementation of frame visuals for the model editor [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/9bf4ea2619c9485ab6e4cb2b05e8c966be4021d1?at=default), I'll share a screen shot when I can, but it basically looks like the joint visuals, just smaller and without arrow heads.

    * Pros: More compact, shows direction.

    * Cons: Very similar to joint visuals, disappears inside model.
